From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin īgnōrāre. Doublet of the inherited enyorar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central) [iŋ.nuˈɾa]
  • IPA(key): (Balearic) [iŋ.noˈɾa]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [iŋ.noˈɾaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)

Verb

[edit]

ignorar (first-person singular present ignoro, first-person singular preterite ignorí, past participle ignorat); root stress: (Central, Valencia, Balearic) /o/

  1. (transitive) to not know; to be ignorant of
    Synonym: desconèixer
    Antonym: saber
  2. (transitive) to ignore (to deliberately not pay attention to)

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of ignorar (first conjugation)

plural ignorats ignorades

Further reading

[edit]
  • “ignorar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007
  • “ignorar”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025
  • “ignorar” in Diccionari normatiu valencià, Acadèmia Valenciana de la Llengua.
  • “ignorar” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.

Galician

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • iñorar

Etymology

[edit]

Learned borrowing from Latin īgnōrāre (“not to know; to ignore”).

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): [iɡnoˈɾaɾ], [inoˈɾaɾ]

Verb

[edit]

ignorar (first-person singular present ignoro, first-person singular preterite ignorei, past participle ignorado)

  1. (transitive) to not know; to be ignorant of
    Synonym: descoñecer
    Antonym: saber
    • 1812, Antonio Benito Fandiño, A Casamenteira:
      Ai tontiño, porque iñoras
      o qu’he mantér casa e vida,
      que por ben que estea sortida,
      hai faltas a todas horas.
      O segundo, que teu pai
      pensa com’home de ben,
      e así por vergonza ten
      unha nora que non trai.
      Orasme, sobr’esto hai,
      que a dous parizós que teña,
      non tendes donde vos veña,
      cando ela non colla un mal.
      Oh, silly, because you don't know
      what it is to keep house and life,
      no matter how well stocked it is,
      there's lack at all hours.
      Second, your father
      thinks like a good man,
      and to his shame he has
      a daughter-in-law who doesn't bear.
      However, on this matter,
      with just two childbirths that she has,
      you'll be left resourceless,
      and that if she doesn't get sick.
  2. (transitive) to ignore (to deliberately not pay attention to)

Related terms

[edit]
  • ignorancia
  • ignorante

References

[edit]

Further reading

[edit]
  • “ignorar”, in Dicionario da Real Academia Galega (in Galician), A Coruña: Royal Galician Academy, 2012–2025

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin īgnōrāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • Audio (Béarn):(file)

Verb

[edit]

ignorar

  1. (transitive) to not know; to be ignorant of
    Antonym: saber
  2. (transitive) to ignore (to deliberately not pay attention to)

Portuguese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin īgnōrāre (“not to know; to ignore”).

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /i.ɡi.noˈɾa(ʁ)/ [i.ɡi.noˈɾa(h)], /iɡ.noˈɾa(ʁ)/ [iɡ.noˈɾa(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /i.ɡi.noˈɾa(ʁ)/ [i.ɡi.noˈɾa(h)], /iɡ.noˈɾa(ʁ)/ [iɡ.noˈɾa(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /i.ɡi.noˈɾa(ɾ)/, /iɡ.noˈɾa(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /i.ɡi.noˈɾa(ʁ)/ [i.ɡi.noˈɾa(χ)], /iɡ.noˈɾa(ʁ)/ [iɡ.noˈɾa(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /iɡ.noˈɾa(ɻ)/, /i.ɡi.noˈɾa(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /i.ɡnuˈɾaɾ/ [i.ɣnuˈɾaɾ]
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /i.ɡnuˈɾaɾ/ [i.ɣnuˈɾaɾ]
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /i.ɡnuˈɾa.ɾi/ [i.ɣnuˈɾa.ɾi]

Verb

[edit]

ignorar (first-person singular present ignoro, first-person singular preterite ignorei, past participle ignorado)

  2. (transitive) to ignore (to deliberately pay no attention to)
    O professor ignorava as perguntas dos alunos.
    The teacher ignored the students’ questions.
  4. (obsolete, transitive) to ignore (not to know; to be ignorant about)
    Synonym: desconhecer
  6. (figurative, transitive) to lack an important quality
    Synonym: carecer de
    Essa resposta ignora o bom senso.
    This answer ignores common sense.

Conjugation

[edit]

Preterite ignorei ignoraste ignorou ignoramos1, ignorámos2 ignorastes ignoraram
Pluperfect ignorara ignoraras ignorara ignoráramos ignoráreis ignoraram
Future ignorarei ignorarás ignorará ignoraremos ignorareis ignorarão
Conditional ignoraria ignorarias ignoraria ignoraríamos ignoraríeis ignorariam
Subjunctive
Present ignore ignores ignore ignoremos ignoreis ignorem
Imperfect ignorasse ignorasses ignorasse ignorássemos ignorásseis ignorassem
Future ignorar ignorares ignorar ignorarmos ignorardes ignorarem
Imperative
Affirmative ignora ignore ignoremos ignorai ignorem
Negative (não) não ignores não ignore não ignoremos não ignoreis não ignorem

1Brazilian Portuguese.
2European Portuguese.

Synonyms

[edit]
  • (to ignore): deixar (informal), esquecer (informal), deixar passar

Related terms

[edit]
  • ignorância
  • ignorante

Further reading

[edit]
  • “ignorar”, in Dicionário Priberam da Língua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), Lisbon: Priberam, 2008–2025

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin īgnōrāre "I do not know, am unacquainted with, ignore", from in- + gnārus (“knowing”). Doublet of añorar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /iɡnoˈɾaɾ/ [iɣ̞.noˈɾaɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: ig‧no‧rar

Verb

[edit]

ignorar (first-person singular present ignoro, first-person singular preterite ignoré, past participle ignorado)

  1. (transitive) to not know; to be ignorant of
    Synonym: desconocer
    Antonym: saber
  2. (transitive) to ignore, to disregard (to deliberately not pay attention to)
    Antonym: prestar atención

Conjugation

[edit]

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.

accusative ignorame ignorate ignoralo, ignorala ignoranos not used ignoralos, ignoralas
with formal second-person singular imperative ignore dative ignóreme not used ignórele, ignórese ignórenos not used ignóreles
accusative ignóreme not used ignórelo, ignórela, ignórese ignórenos not used ignórelos, ignórelas
with first-person plural imperative ignoremos dative not used ignorémoste ignorémosle ignorémonos ignorémoos ignorémosles
accusative not used ignorémoste ignorémoslo, ignorémosla ignorémonos ignorémoos ignorémoslos, ignorémoslas
with informal second-person plural imperative ignorad dative ignoradme not used ignoradle ignoradnos ignoraos ignoradles
accusative ignoradme not used ignoradlo, ignoradla ignoradnos ignoraos ignoradlos, ignoradlas
with formal second-person plural imperative ignoren dative ignórenme not used ignórenle ignórennos not used ignórenles, ignórense
accusative ignórenme not used ignórenlo, ignórenla ignórennos not used ignórenlos, ignórenlas, ignórense

Related terms

[edit]
  • ignorancia
  • ignorante
